PolicyPage.Title: 3x3 Basketball Rules, Men/Women
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Rule 1: Game Play

Equipment

•       Shoes with non-marking soles must be worn to play Intramural Basketball.

•       All participants are required to wear legally numbered jerseys that are the same color during intramural play:

Players

•       Players must check in prior to entering the game.

•       A team is made up of at least 2 players and no more than 5 players.  There are only 3 players on the court at one time.

 

Start of Game

•       The game will be started with a jump ball.

•      Substitutions can be made at any time when there is a dead ball.

•      When a team is fouled, they will either maintain possession of the ball, or gain possession of the ball.  There are NO free throws.

•      After each successful basket, the ball is taken out, behind the three point line, by the other team to change possession.

•      At each change of possession the ball must be cleared behind the three point line.

Timing

•       Games will be played to 21 points or for 15 minutes whichever comes first. 

•      Teams will be given one minute to warm-up prior to the game.

•      Teams will be present when the game is ready to start, or the team will forfeit.

Referees

There will be no referees in 3 on 3 Basketball. Each court will have one score keeper and one staff member to settle any dispute

 

Scoring

Baskets will be worth 1 point when shot from inside the three point line and 2 points when shot from outside the three point line.

Mercy Rule

There is no Mercy Rule in 3 on 3 Basketball.

 

Dead ball

When ball goes out of bounds or a basket is made.

 

Out of Bounds

•       A player is out of bounds when they contact the floor or any other object other than a player/person on or outside a boundary line.

•       The ball is out of bounds when it is contacted by a player, person, the floor, or any object that is outside a boundary. Boundaries are to half court.

•       The ball is out of bounds when it contacts the supports or back of the backboard, the ceiling, or the overhead equipment/supports.

 

Misconduct

Language- any misbehavior or bad language- will result in an ejection from the game.

 

Violations & Penalties

The penalty for traveling, jump ball, etc. is loss of possession.

•       Travel: A player holding the ball may not move a foot or feet in excess of the limits prescribed.

•       Kick: A player may not kick or strike the ball with any part of their leg or foot.

•       Illegal Dribble: A player may not dribble a second time after their first dribble has ended unless the player has lost control due to a try for goal, touch by an opponent, or pass or fumble that has been touched by another player.

•       A player may not palm or carry the ball during a dribble.

•       Excessive Swinging of Elbows: A player may not excessively swing their elbows.

 

Fouls & Penalties

Incidental contact (contact that does not hinder an offensive or defensive player from normal movement) is allowed, however contact in the following forms by a players arm(s) or leg(s) is restricted:

•       Holding

•       Pushing

•       Charging

•       Hitting

•       Blocking

•       Tripping

The penalty for such fouls is the ball turn over to the other team or may result in suspension from tournament.
